title: Strauss 2017 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)
description: Yellow plum is boosted by bright ripe notes of Amalfi lemon alongside some grassy hints. The palate has a similarly bright, fruity and expressive outlook. Zesty citrus dominates the light dry body and leads onto a dry finish.

title: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2016 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)
description: Magenta in color, aromas of blueberry and pomegranate are muddled with strawberry, white pepper and vanilla on the nose of this delightful Cabernet Franc. The palate is juicy and bright in tones of pomegranate and red cherry, tempered by white pepper, vanilla and fine grained tannins. The juicy fruit flavors pleasantly linger, leading to a second wave of white pepper on the finish.

title: Torre a Cona 2015 Badia a Corte Riserva  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)
description: This leads with black-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and leather aromas. On the juicy palate, firm tannins frame ripe black plum, clove and star anise hints. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Travignoli 2014 Tegolaia Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)
description: This has tilled soil, moist underbrush, leather and herb aromas. On the racy, linear palate, close-grained tannins and bright acidity support wild cherry and tobacco flavors, with an earthy hint of game. Drink through 2024.

title: Valduero 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Mild cherry and berry aromas include a dash of baking spices. A crisp racy palate is based on fresh acidity and tight tannins. Earthy plum, cherry and currant flavors are the slightest bit oxidized, while this is steady and sturdy on the finish.

title: Vasco Urbano 2015 Brunswick; Casa de Vinas Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Brawny and tannic, this dark-colore, full-bodied and firm-textured wine has tasty blackberry and black pepper flavors that are bound up tightly by a thick layer of tannin. It will take a lot of patience but the wine may be fantastic when well aged. Best after 2028.

title: Villa San Juliette 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Desiccated strawberries, dark plums, leather and char show on the nose of this bottling, which leans toward the dried-fruit side of the spectrum. It starts a tad sweet on the palate but opens up into a very floral expression with hints of blueberries and toast. Acid drives into the caramel-kissed finish.

title: Waxwing 2017 Delfina's Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Red plum, strawberry, tangerines and clay aromas show on the nose of this pink wine. There is decent grip to the sip, with plenty of mandarin orange juice and skin flavors, proving quite lively.

title: Xavier Vignon 2017 White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Hints of hazelnut and bramble accent fresh Asian pear, grapefruit and lime flavors here. While full bodied and lavishly textured, it's balanced by a crisp mineral backbone and lively acidity. Drink now–2020.

title: Antonelli 2012  Montefalco Sagrantino
description: Made from organically grown grapes, this opens with subtle graphite and mature, black-skinned fruit aromas. The firm palate delivers roasted coffee bean, prune and tobacco notes alongside astringent tannins. Drink 2022–2028.

title: Boccafosca 2015 Oinochoe  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: This wine's citrus, yellow flower and sage aromas merge together in the glass. The lively palate offers Bartlett pear and grapefruit flavors, with an almondy finish carried by crisp acidity. Drink through 2020.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Castellani 2015 L'Antico di Burchino  (Chianti)
description: Made from organically farmed Sangiovese, Ciliegiolo and Canaiolo, this opens with red berry, tilled earth and dried herb aromas. The juicy palate doles out black plum, licorice and crushed mint flavors alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Chai de Bordes 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This bright, fruity wine is crisp with delicious acidity and ripe with rich apricot and pear flavors. It is a full-bodied wine but one that is balanced with lively aftertaste and touches of spice. Drink now.

title: Château de la Noblesse 2017 Rosé (Bandol)
description: This is an opulent style of rosé, dense with the typical lightly herbal character of Mourvèdre. It is a full wine, certainly better with food, finishing with a spicy, peppery aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château de l'Escarelle 2017 Mes Bastides Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: Tangy and fruity, this wine is crisp, perfumed and rich. Acidity and citrus flavors give the wine a refreshing heart while the red fruits deliver weight and delicious fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Château de Nages 2017 Buti Nages Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Pretty and perfumed, this lavishly mouth-filling rosé offers loads of fresh apricot, strawberry and watermelon flavors. Dry, with a juicy, thirst-quenching feel, it's elevated by a crystalline mineral backbone and sprightly acidity. Drink now–2020.

title: Château de Seguin 2017 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Fruity aromas are followed through by ripe apple and apricot flavors. These make for a rich, smooth wine, packed with dense fruitiness and final acidity. The aftertaste is ripe and full. Drink now.

title: Château d'Ollières 2014 Prestige Syrah-Grenache (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: A smooth and balanced wine that has almost fully developed, this is rich while also having crisp black-currant and blueberry fruitiness. Ripe tannins and acidity go with the spice that has come from 18 months in wood. It's a ripe wine, ready to drink from 2019.

title: Château La Rose Saint Germain 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This wine is packed with ripe apple, quince and hints of apricot. Spice flavors give it a fine bite at the end. Drink this balanced, full and fruity wine now.

title: Château Lauduc 2017 Classic  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This rich wine has a crisp edge to balance its generous apple and green-pear flavors. The creamy texture is full, leavened by crisp herbaceousness. The two elements give a rich, intense wine that will benefit from aging. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château L'Ermitage 2017 Auzan White (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Opening notes of dried herbs and smoke lend a savory shadow to this wine's crisp yellow peach, apple and pear fruit. Full bodied yet freshly balanced, it's a satisfyingly rich dry white that finishes with a twist of lime zest. Drink now–2020.

title: Château L'Ermitage 2017 Sainte Cécile White (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Fermented and matured in French oak, this bold white wine offers robust yellow apple and pear flavors with heady accents of vanilla, spice and cinnamon toast. It's exuberant yet elegantly dry and finishes with fine, feathery tannins.

title: Château Rauzan Despagne 2017 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Ripe, soft and well balanced, this wine is already delicious. Layers of apricot, white peach and quince come with just the right amount of acidity and lemon zest. Drink now.

title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2015 La Bargemone Cuvée Marina Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Syrah, Grenache and Cabernet Sauvignon have produced a rich, smooth, oak-aged wine. It is smoky with plenty of ripe blackberry and black-currant fruits backed by tannins and a touch of stalkiness. The wine is still young, still developing. Wait until 2020.

title: Der Pollerhof 2017 Galgenberg Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: A very slight but rather refreshing note of green pear appears on the nose. On the palate this is amplified with more intense notes of Conference pear, guided by lemon freshness to a dry moreish finish.

title: Domaine de la Janasse 2017 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Dark, savory notes of dried oregano and thyme juxtapose riper, fruitier raspberry and watermelon tones in this plump rosé. It's rounded and rich on the palate, balanced by fresh acidity and lingering, tea-like tannins. A refreshing yet structured wine to enjoy with foods year round.

title: Domaine de la Petite Cassagne 2015 Red (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Luscious black cherry and raspberry flavors are marked by hints of violet, leather and fresh herbs in this in this fruity yet nuanced red. It's full bodied and intensely concentrated yet briskly composed. Ripe but persistent tannins frame the finish.

title: Domaine Guy Mousset 2017 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Pristine red raspberry and sour cherry flavors abound in this juicy, invigorating rosé. While full bodied and richly textured, it's delightfully pert and fresh, with a phenolic fringe that extends to the finish. It's structured enough to enjoy with meals far beyond the summer months.

title: Domäne Wachau 2017 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: The nose only reveals the merest touch of fresh Conference pear peel but the palate fleshes out the green-pear fruit and adds a lovely zesty lemon tang to it. The body is slender and fluid, light and dry.

title: Donatella Cinelli Colombini 2015 Fattoria il Colle  (Chianti Superiore)
description: Aromas of ripe blackberry, tilled earth and pressed violet come to the forefront. On the juicy, savory palate, supple tannins cushion fleshy black cherry, raspberry jam and star anise. Enjoy through 2019.
